title: Lammermuir (1856 clipper)
text:
Lammermuir, named for the <a href="Lammermuir%20Hills">Lammermuir Hills</a>, was a tea <a href="clipper">clipper</a> built in <a href="Sunderland%2C%20Tyne%20and%20Wear">Sunderland</a> by <a href="William%20Pile%20%28shipbuilder%29">William Pile</a>. She was the first clipper owned by <a href="Jock%20Willis%20Shipping%20Line">Jock Willis Shipping Line</a>. She was a fast sailer, being the second ship home in the 1858-59 tea season. She was a favourite of John Willis senior.
Construction.
"Lammermuir" measured 178'0" × 34'0" × 22'0", with tonnage 952 NRT. Whilst she did not set any sails above <a href="Royal%20%28sail%29">royals</a>, she did have a great spread of sail.
Loss of the ship.
When she was wrecked on the Amherst Reef in the Macclesfield Channel, <a href="Gaspar%20Strait">Gaspar Strait</a> on 31 December 1863, Jock "White Hat" Willis commissioned another ship by the same name, the "<a href="Lammermuir%20%281864%20clipper%29">Lammermuir</a>" of 1864.
The wreck of the original "Lammermuir" was still visible above the water line in August 1866 when the new "Lammermuir" sailed past en route to <a href="China">China</a> and also later in 1874.
